Package utilities

Class Space

java.lang.Object
utilities.Space
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Space
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This class stores gameplay data to fit the needs of the Minesweeper game's mine field. Each Space object represents a space in the mine field and its relevant data. This object keeps track of whether or not the space has a mine, whether or not it has been revealed by the player, whether or not it has a flag, and the number of mines that are adjacent to it (if it is not a mine itself).
Author:
Katherine Wilson
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • hasMine

      private boolean hasMine
      true if this Space contains a mine.
      false if it's safe.

    • revealed

      private boolean revealed
      true if this Space has been revealed by the player.
      false if it has not.

    • hasFlag

      private boolean hasFlag
      true if this Space contains a flag.
      false if it does not.

    • adjacentMines

      private int adjacentMines
      An integer representing the number of mines that are adjacent to the Space. This calculation is based off of both cardinal and intermediate directions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Space

      public Space()
      Creates a Space object and initializes it to a default state. By default, a Space object contains no mines, contains no flags, has not been revealed by the player, and has zero adjacent mines.

  • Method Details

    • placeMine

      public void placeMine()
      Places a mine in this Space. Sets the hasMine flag to true. Does not check if this Space already contains a mine.

    • removeMine

      public void removeMine()
      Removes a mine from this Space. Sets the hasMine flag to false. Does not check if this Space contains a mine.

    • addAdjacentMine

      public void addAdjacentMine()
      Increments the value that keeps track of the number of mines that are adjacent to this Space.

    • placeFlag

      public void placeFlag()
      Places a flag in this Space. Sets hasFlag to true. Does not check if this Space already contains a flag.

    • removeFlag

      public void removeFlag()
      Removes a flag from this Space. Sets hasFlag to false. Does not check if this Space doesn't contain a flag.

    • reveal

      public void reveal()
      Marks this Space as revealed. This should be called when the player steps on this space or it is revealed by proxy. Sets hasFlag to true. Does not check if this Space has already been revealed.

    • hasFlag

      public boolean hasFlag()
      Returns whether or not this Space has been flagged by the player.
      Returns:
      true if this Space contains a flag.
      false if this Space does not contain a flag.

    • hasMine

      public boolean hasMine()
      Returns whether or not this Space contains a mine or not.
      Returns:
      true if this Space contains a mine.
      false if this Space does not contain a mine.

    • isRevealed

      public boolean isRevealed()
      Returns whether or not this Space has been revealed by the player yet or not. This occurs when the space is "confirmed safe" either by the player directly stepping on this place, or this place being found through contiguous means.
      Returns:
      true if this Space has been revealed.
      false if this Space has not been revealed yet.

    • adjacentMines

      public int adjacentMines()
      Returns the number of mines that are adjacent to this Space. This refers to the number of mines that can be found within each of the 8 Spaces that surround the Space.
      Returns:
      the number of mines surrounding this Space.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the string form of the current space which reflects its status. This includes whether or not it contains a mine or flag or if it has been revealed or not.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a one-character string indicating describing this Space.
